title: Vaccine Info
description: Learn more about the vaccines, side effects and distribution.
cleaned_text: Vaccine Information for Patients What you need to know - [Everyone aged 6 years and older](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#everyone-6-and-older)should get 1 updated bivalent Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine to be considered [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#up-to-date). - [People aged 65 years and older](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#additional-booster)may get a 2nd updated Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 bivalent dose. - [People who are moderately or severely immunocompromised](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/clinical-considerations/interim-considerations-us.html#immunocompromised)may get additional updated Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 bivalent doses. - [Children aged 6 months - 5 years](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#children-5-and-under)may need multiple doses of COVID-19 vaccine to be [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#up-to-date), including at least 1 updated dose of Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, depending on the number of doses they've previously received and their age. How do I schedule an appointment? COVID-19 vaccine doses are offered at select Scripps HealthExpress locations throughout San Diego County. To schedule an appointment, go to the MyScripps " [Schedule an Appointment](https://myscripps.org/MyChart/Scheduling)" menu option, select "COVID-19 Vaccination" and follow the prompts — to view all available appointment slots be sure to select "All Locations" and "All Providers." Learn how to [set up a MyScripps account](https://www.scripps.org/news_items/6878-connect-with-your-health-care-enroll-in-myscripps-patient-portal) if you don't have one already. Appointments are also available at [locations](http://www.vaccines.gov/) throughout San Diego County. Individuals without access to a computer or someone to assist them can call the California Department of Public Health COVID-19 hotline at [833-422-4255](tel:+18334224255). Operators are available who speak English and Spanish, and can access a third-party translator for more than 250 additional languages. What types of COVID-19 vaccines does Scripps offer? Age 6 months to 4 years Scripps offers a bivalent Moderna vaccine for patients aged 6 months - 4 years who have never been vaccinated or have not completed their primary dose series. Children aged 6 months - 4 years who have received two monovalent doses are advised to get a bivalent booster; however, these are not available at Scripps for this age group at this time. Instead, please schedule an appointment at [MyTurn](https://myturn.ca.gov/). Ages 5-11 years Per the CDC's recommendations, Scripps offers a bivalent Pfizer vaccine for patients 5-11 years of age who have never been vaccinated or have never received a bivalent dose. 12 years and older Scripps offers bivalent Moderna or Pfizer vaccines for patients 12 years of age and older, who have never been vaccinated or have never received a bivalent dose. 65 and older Scripps offers additional doses of bivalent Moderna or Pfizer vaccines for those patients 65 and older who have already received a bivalent vaccine more than four months prior. Immunocompromised patients Scripps offers an additional dose of bivalent Moderna or Pfizer booster for immunocompromised patients who have already received a bivalent vaccine more than two months prior. Recommendations for children ages 6 months - 11 years [Children aged 6 months - 11 years](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#children-5-and-under) may need multiple doses of COVID-19 vaccine to be [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html#up-to-date), including at least 1 updated bivalent dose of a Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, depending on the number of doses they've previously received and their age. Scripps offers a bivalent Moderna vaccine for patients aged 6 months - 4 years who have never been vaccinated or have not completed their primary dose series. Children aged 6 months - 4 years who have received two monovalent doses are advised to get a bivalent booster; however, these are not available at Scripps for this age group at this time. Instead, please schedule an appointment at [MyTurn](https://myturn.ca.gov/). COVID-19 vaccine appointments are available for children aged 6 months - 11 years in the [MyScripps patient portal](https://myscripps.org/mychart). You can also visit [vaccines.gov](http://www.vaccines.gov/) to find alternative locations offering COVID-19 pediatric vaccines. If you haven't done so already, we encourage you to sign up for a MyScripps proxy account if you are the parent or guardian of a minor. This will allow you to schedule a vaccine appointment for your child. Log in to your MyScripps account, go to [request access to a minor](https://myscripps.org/MyChart/inside.asp?mode=showform&formName=CustSvcRequestMinorAccess) and submit a form for each child you'd like access to. You may also set up proxy access in person at any Scripps facility. Digital vaccine record How can I get a digital COVID-19 vaccine record? Your digital COVID-19 vaccine record is an electronic vaccination record available in your [MyScripps patient portal](https://myscripps.org/MyChart/default.asp). If you did not receive your vaccine at a Scripps location and don't see it in MyScripps, you can generate a QR code through the [State of California](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/). How can I update my medical record? If you received one or both of your COVID-19 vaccine doses outside of a Scripps Health facility, we may have already received vaccine records from other vaccination locations in California and automatically updated your medical records. If not, you can update your COVID vaccine history through your MyScripps account once you have received both doses. Log into [MyScripps](https://myscripps.org/MyChart/default.asp) and go to My Record > COVID-19. From there you can click to pull in your vaccine history from outside of Scripps, or upload an image of your vaccine card. Vaccine FAQs How much does the COVID-19 vaccine cost? The federal government will cover the cost of the vaccine itself. Your insurance may be billed for the cost to administer the vaccine to you. However, there is no out-of-pocket cost to you. Additional information Please visit the [CDC website](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html) for the most up-to-date information regarding COVID vaccines and boosters.
